root.name: setInt()

example.code: def setup(): table = Table() table.addColumn("number", Table.INT) table.addColumn("mass", Table.FLOAT) table.addColumn("name", Table.STRING) table.addRow() # Creates an empty row table.setInt(0, "number", 8) table.setFloat(0, "mass", 15.9994) table.setString(0, "name", "Oxygen") println(table.getInt(0, "number")) # Prints 8 println(nf(table.getFloat(0, "mass"), 2, 4) # Prints 15.9994 println(table.getString(0, "name")) # Prints "Oxygen"

root.description: Stores an integer value in the Table's specified row and column. The row is specified by its ID, while the column may be specified by either its ID or title.

parameter.label: row
parameter.description: int: ID number of the target row

parameter.label: column
parameter.description: int: ID number of the target column

parameter.label: columnName
parameter.description: String: title of the target column
